Нгдтап and McLaughlin,  Rank 3 subgroups of finite symplectic and unitary groups

4.  Groups generated by elations
The purpose of the next three sections is to prove
Theorem 1.  Let ö be a polarity of symplectic or unitary type of the projective space P = P ( i ( g ) of dimension d '^ 2 over Fq,  Then a set of elations in Aut < 5 ( P ) containing a ( P,  P ^ yelation for each absolute point P generates Tô ( P ).
In the present section the case d = 2 is treated,  in the next section the case d = 3 is established,  and finally in § 6 the induction step from d to d + 2 is demonstrated.  Of course the theorem is trivial for Çq a prime. 
It would be extremely interesting to move the condition that P be desarguesian from the hypothesis to the conclusion in this theorem for the case d = 2,  that is,  to show that a finite projective plane ж admitting a polarity ô of “ unitary type ” and a ( P,  P- *-)~ elation for each absolute point P is necessarily desarguesian.  The right definition of “ unitary type ” might be that a line containing two absolute points contains Wq + 1,  where the order of л : is Wo.  It would still be very interesting to prove this under the assumption that ж admits all possible ( P,  P ^)- elations.
